listingsPreview.name: Autopailot
listingsPreview.tagLine: Let GPT-4 respond to your customer’s questions
listingsPreview.description: Let AI reply to your customers' questions, more reliably than a human would, in any language, with no wait times. 100x cheaper than a support team.

listingsPreview.name: Azure OpenAI Service
listingsPreview.tagLine: GPT-4 is now available via the Azure OpenAI Service
listingsPreview.description:
Azure OpenAI Service offers industry-leading language models that you can fine-tune to your specific needs for a variety of use cases. Azure announced GPT-4 is available in preview in Azure OpenAI Service. With this milestone, they bring the world’s most advanced AI models—including GPT-3.5, ChatGPT, and DALL•E 2—to Azure customers, backed by Azure AI-optimized infrastructure, enterprise-readiness, compliance, data security, and privacy controls, along with many integrations with other Azure services.

Customers can begin applying for access to GPT-4 today.

Source: https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/introducing-gpt4-in-azure-openai-service/

listingsPreview.name: Virtual Volunteer by Be My Eyes
listingsPreview.tagLine: A digital visual assistant powered by GPT-4

listings.name: Virtual Volunteer by Be My Eyes

listingsPreview.description:
Whether you need a pair of sharp eyes or have some sight to lend, Be My Eyes is a simple, free tool to help people see the world better, together.

Virtual Volunteer tool, currently in beta testing, will push further toward achieving the goal to improve accessibility, usability, and access to information globally, and aligns us with OpenAI’s stated principles on developing safe and responsible AI.

The Virtual Volunteer feature from Be My Eyes will be integrated into the existing app and is powered by OpenAI’s new GPT-4 language model, which contains a dynamic new image-to-text generator. Users can send images via the app to an AI-powered Virtual Volunteer, which will answer any question about that image and provide instantaneous visual assistance for a wide variety of tasks.

This technology will be transformative in providing people who are blind or have low vision with powerful new resources to better navigate physical environments, address everyday needs, and gain more independence.

This feature is currently in a closed beta and is being tested for feedback among a small subset of our users.

Source: https://www.bemyeyes.com/blog/introducing-be-my-eyes-virtual-volunteer

listingsPreview.name: Casetext CoCounsel
listingsPreview.tagLine: The first AI legal assistant powered by GPT-4
listingsPreview.description:
Legal AI company Casetext announced that its AI legal assistant, CoCounsel, is powered by GPT-4, the latest, most advanced large language model from OpenAI. Casetext also confirms that GPT-4 has passed both the multiple-choice and written portions of the Uniform Bar Exam (UBE), a first for this technology. GPT-4's advanced reasoning—validated by its performance on the bar—has unlocked professional-grade AI for law, ushering in an era of rapid and profound change in the legal industry.

Source: https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/casetexts-cocounsel-the-first-ai-legal-assistant-is-powered-by-openais-gpt-4-the-first-large-language-model-to-pass-bar-exam-301771962.html

listingsPreview.name: Chatfuel AI
listingsPreview.tagLine: Take customer communication to the next level with AI
listingsPreview.description:
Chatfuel is the leading bot platform for creating AI chatbots for Facebook. Learn how to create a Facebook Messenger bot quickly and easily - no coding required.

It uses built-in GPT-4 by Open AI to tell customers about your business, answer their questions, recommend products and services, and more. It works on the most popular messengers and platforms: Telegram, Facebook Messenger, Instagram, WhatsApp, Line, and your website.

listingsPreview.name: Chatsonic
listingsPreview.tagLine: A ChatGPT alternative powered by GPT-4
listingsPreview.description: ChatSonic a conversational AI chatbot is like ChatGPT but built with superpowers and now GPT-4 powered. Check out the best ChatGPT alternative to create content

listingsPreview.name: Climate Policy Radar
listingsPreview.description: Use Climate Policy Radar’s data science and AI-powered platform to search and explore thousands of climate change laws, policies and legal cases worldwide

listingsPreview.name: Coursera
listingsPreview.description: Join Coursera for free and learn online. Build skills with courses from top universities like Yale, Michigan, Stanford, and leading companies like Google and IBM. Advance your career with degrees, certificates, Specializations, & MOOCs in data science, computer science, business, and dozens of other topics.

listingsPreview.name: Diagram
listingsPreview.tagLine: Generative Creativity powered by GPT-4
listingsPreview.description: Be more creative with generative design tools. Diagram is a design tools company reimagining UI design in the era of generative AI. We’re a small team of builders, creatives, and prototypers looking to grow individually and together.

listingsPreview.name: DoNotPay
listingsPreview.tagLine: Using GPT-4 for One-Click Lawsuits Against Robocallers
listingsPreview.description: DoNotPay, the "world's first robot lawyer" app, plans to use GPT-4 for "one-click lawsuits" against robocallers. However, GPT-4 has a dissenting opinion, warning that it cannot provide legal advice. DoNotPay founder Joshua Browder previously planned to use DoNotPay to defend a client in a live situation but had to cancel the endeavor after facing legal warnings. A lawsuit was later filed against DoNotPay for violations of California's unfair competition law. Browder plans to use GPT-4's multimodal feature to identify errors in medical bills and draft a legal defense.

listingsPreview.name: Dropbox
listingsPreview.tagLine: Dropbox features powered by GPT-4
listingsPreview.description: Dropbox is one of the GPT-4 launching partners. Dropbox is a modern workspace designed to reduce busywork-so you can focus on the things that matter. Sign in and put your creative energy to work.

listingsPreview.name: Drupal
listingsPreview.description: Drupal is an extremely popular open source CMS that has tons of features like Webform and Form Builder, as well as everything you'd need to handle your standard content.

listingsPreview.name: Duolingo Max
listingsPreview.tagLine: A learning experience powered by GPT-4
listingsPreview.description:
Duolingo Max is a new subscription tier above Super Duolingo that gives learners access to two brand-new features and exercises: Explain My Answer and Roleplay. Both are powered by the newest, most powerful generative AI technology. Duolingo has been working closely with OpenAI for months to refine the technology and get it ready for learners.

Duolingo has been developing this AI secret sauce for years to make education more effective, affordable, and engaging. The language learning app uses its custom AI to help you find the right course level, tailor lessons just for you, and give you personalized feedback. In September 2022, Duolingo and OpenAI began collaborating to build brand-new learning features using GPT-4. This meant training the model for Duolingo’s special use case, ensuring the product had proper safety guardrails, double-checking the accuracy of its explanations, and tweaking the prompts used in Duolingo Max.

Duolingo also puts AI to the test through its Duolingo English Test (DET), the leading high-stakes English proficiency exam available online, on demand. By using AI in every step of the testing process, including generating questions, scoring the test, and keeping the test secure, the DET makes educational opportunities more affordable for millions of students.

Source: https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2023/03/14/2627053/0/en/Duolingo-Max-Shows-the-Future-of-AI-Education.html

listingsPreview.name: Elicit
listingsPreview.tagLine: Group science by concepts powered by GPT-4
listingsPreview.description:
Elicit is an AI research assistant that GPT-4 aims to make even more useful. “Elicit in 2022 took unstructured text in papers and structured it into a table. Elicit in 2023 will take this structured text and enable you to ‘pivot’ it, grouping it by concepts,” announced developer Jungwon on Twitter.

Source: https://twitter.com/jungofthewon/status/1635725465901219841

listingsPreview.name: Epic
listingsPreview.tagLine: Helping physicians and nurses spend less time at the keyboard with GPT-4
listingsPreview.description:
EPIC's investigation of GPT-4 has shown tremendous potential for its use in healthcare. EPIC will use it to help physicians and nurses spend less time at the keyboard and to help them investigate data in more conversational, easy-to-use ways.

Source: https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/introducing-gpt4-in-azure-openai-service/

listingsPreview.name: Fin
listingsPreview.tagLine: The First AI Customer Service Bot Built with GPT-4
listingsPreview.description: Intercom, the only AI-powered, complete customer service solution, announced it has built a breakthrough AI customer service bot called Fin, powered by OpenAI's GPT-4 and Intercom's proprietary machine learning technology. Fin provides trustworthy and accurate answers to customer questions, saving time for customers and support teams.

listingsPreview.name: GitHub Copilot
listingsPreview.tagLine: The AI-powered developer experience
listingsPreview.description:
GitHub Copilot works alongside you directly in your editor, suggesting whole lines or entire functions for you. [GitHub Next](https://githubnext.com/) has been working to move past the editor and evolve GitHub Copilot into a readily accessible AI assistant throughout the entire development lifecycle. This is GitHub Copilot X—our vision for the future of AI-powered software development. They are not only adopting OpenAI’s new GPT-4 model, but are introducing chat and voice for Copilot, and bringing Copilot to pull requests, the command line, and docs to answer questions on your projects.

Even though the GPT-4 was just released, they already notice significant gains in logical reasoning and code generation. With GPT-4, the state of AI is beginning to catch up with GitHub's ambition to create an AI pair programmer that assists with every development task at every point in the developer experience.

listingsPreview.name: Government of Iceland
listingsPreview.tagLine: GPT-4 to Aid in the Preservation of the Icelandic Language
listingsPreview.description:
The Icelandic government is using GPT-4 to its advantage to preserve its language. GPT-4 has made significant improvements in its ability to respond in Icelandic, improvements that are partly the result of a collaboration inspired by an Icelandic delegation’s visit to OpenAI ’s headquarters in May of last year. The delegation, consisting of Iceland’s President and government ministers, met with OpenAI’s founder, Sam Altman.

As noted by [the New York Times](https://www.nytimes.com/2023/03/14/technology/openai-new-gpt4.html), GPT-4 has shown impressive improvements in accuracy when compared to its predecessor (GPT-3.5): it’s gained the ability to summarise and comment on images, summarise complicated texts, and is capable of passing a bar exam and several standardised tests; however, it still shows a tendency to hallucinate answers.

Likewise, GPT-4, while much better at Icelandic than GPT-3.5, still produces Icelandic with “grammatical errors, ‘translationese,’ and incorrect cultural knowledge.” To make further improvements, Vilhjálmur Þorsteinsson, CEO of Miðeind (a privately owned software company based in Reykjavík that specialises in language technology), assembled a team of 40 volunteers to train GPT-4 on proper Icelandic grammar and cultural knowledge.

Source: https://www.icelandreview.com/news/gpt-4-to-aid-in-the-preservation-of-the-icelandic-language/

listingsPreview.name: GPT-4 Doom
listingsPreview.tagLine: Create a basic 3D game prototype like Doom using GPT-4
listingsPreview.description:
AI enthusiast [Javi Lopez](https://twitter.com/javilopen/status/1636085116400451584) who experimented with GPT4 and gave an in-depth breakdown to show how this latest technology could be used for game development purposes. In a twitter thread shared by the user, he demonstrated how to leverage the AI technology to produce basic video games similar to a well-known one like Doom, ways one should use the AI to generate the required codes, showed simple steps on how to increase the game’s prototype visual appeal and showed small glimpses of codes written entirely by the GPT-4 itself.

Source: https://scrollstart.com/gpt-4-has-surpassed-all-expectations-lopez-showed-in-a-twitter-thread/

listingsPreview.name: GPT-4 Playground
listingsPreview.tagLine: The OpenAI Playground to test the GPT-4 multimodal model
listingsPreview.description:
The Playground offers almost all the functionalities of the GPT-4 API, enabling users to explore the capabilities of GPT-4.

The OpenAI Playground is a web-based tool that makes it easy to test prompts and get familiar with how the API works. With the Playground, you can start using GPT-4 without writing a single line of code – you provide the prompt in plain English. Just about everything you could do by calling the API, you can also do in the Playground.

listingsPreview.name: GPT-4 Pong
listingsPreview.tagLine: GPT-4 Created a Playable Version of Pong in Under 60 Seconds
listingsPreview.description:
[Pietro Schirano](https://twitter.com/skirano/status/1635736107949195278), design lead at financial services company Brex and self-proclaimed "AI chef," asked GPT-4 to recommend the best language to "build a pong like game." Schirano also stated he wanted lots of people to be able to play the game.

The model suggested how he should make it before providing a basic example using JavaScript with an HTML5 Canvas API. Schirano then shared a Replit link for those that wanted to play this build. 

Source: https://twitter.com/skirano/status/1635736107949195278

listingsPreview.name: GPT-4 Sketch to Website
listingsPreview.tagLine: Create a working website from a hand-drawn sketch with GPT-4
listingsPreview.description: On a livestream, OpenAI CTO Greg Brockman drew a rough sketch of website, which generated jokes, on a piece of paper. He then took a photo of his rough hand-drawn sketch, and uploaded it into the GPT-4. The model immediately output the code for a website, which was fully functional and designed exactly way as it had been drawn.

listingsPreview.name: GPT-4 Snake Game
listingsPreview.tagLine: Using GPT-4 to code an entire Snake game for you
listingsPreview.description:
Follow along how [Ammaar Reshi](https://twitter.com/ammaar/status/1635754631228952576) recreated a Snake game that runs in your browser using Chat GPT-4 and Replit, with ZERO knowledge of Javascript all in less than 20 mins. 

Full tutorial: https://twitter.com/ammaar/status/1635754631228952576 

Credit: https://twitter.com/ammaar

listingsPreview.name: Harvey
listingsPreview.tagLine: Dynamic Legal Solutions for the AI Revolution
listingsPreview.description:
Harvey is a verticalised version powered by GPT-4, which has been trained on the entire corpus of the internet. It trained the model with legal sector-specific data.

Companies are quickly building new tools with GPT-4, like [Allen & Overy](https://legaltechnology.com/2023/02/16/allen-overy-breaks-the-internet-and-new-ground-with-co-pilot-harvey/) and accounting giant PwC, which just signed a 12-month deal with startup Harvey that will give its lawyers access to an AI tool built on the newest technology.

listingsPreview.name: Milo
listingsPreview.description: Giving parents a co-pilot for the mental load of everyday parenting.

listingsPreview.name: Khan Academy
listingsPreview.tagLine: Harnessing GPT-4 so that all students benefit
listingsPreview.description:
Khanmigo, an AI learning platform from Khan Academy, is powered by GPT-4. Khanmigo serves as a teacher’s assistant in the classroom as well as a virtual tutor for students. Based on each student’s unique requirements and skills, it can deliver individualized training.

Khan Academy is a nonprofit with the mission of providing a free, world-class education for anyone, anywhere.

listingsPreview.name: Kraftful
listingsPreview.description: Kraftful gives you deep AI analysis of user feedback to learn what your users need and how to make your product delightful.

listingsPreview.name: Markprompt
listingsPreview.tagLine: Open-source GPT-4 platform for Markdown, Markdoc and MDX with built-in analytics
listingsPreview.description: Markprompt is a platform for building GPT-powered prompts. It scans Markdown, Markdoc and MDX files in your GitHub repo and creates embeddings that you can use to create a prompt, for instance using the companion Markprompt React component. Markprompt also offers analytics, so you can gain insights on how visitors interact with your docs.

listingsPreview.name: Material Security
listingsPreview.description: Material protects accounts even after they’re compromised or harmful messages get through.

listingsPreview.name: Maybe
listingsPreview.description: Maybe is modern financial planning, investment management and retirement planning.

listingsPreview.name: Mem
listingsPreview.description: Let AI organize your team’s work—from meeting notes, projects, to knowledge bases. All instantly searchable and readily discoverable.

listingsPreview.name: Microsoft 365 Copilot
listingsPreview.tagLine: A generative AI-powered workspace productivity tool
listingsPreview.description:
Microsoft announced Microsoft 365 Copilot, a generative AI-powered workspace productivity tool, at its ‘Future of Work’ event on Thursday. Copilot leverages Large Language Models, Microsoft Graph and Microsoft 365 apps to deliver optimal solutions for individual and business needs.

Microsoft says that the new Copilot will enable users to unleash their creativity, boost their productivity and “uplevel” their skills. “Rediscover the joy of creation by removing the drudgery from daily tasks at work with a powerful Copilot,” said CEO Satya Nadella about the product.

Microsoft 365 Copilot will be integrated into productivity apps and will assist millions of users who depend on applications such as Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Teams, Outlook, etc., to perform their everyday tasks at work.

Source: https://indianexpress.com/article/technology/artificial-intelligence/generative-ai-developments-this-week-gpt-4-to-microsoft-365-copilot-8503686/

listingsPreview.name: Microsoft Bing
listingsPreview.tagLine: The new Bing powered by OpenAI’s GPT-4.
listingsPreview.description: The new Bing is running on GPT-4, which they customized for search. If you’ve used the new Bing preview at any time in the last five weeks, you’ve already experienced an early version of this powerful model. As OpenAI makes updates to GPT-4 and beyond, Bing benefits from those improvements.

listingsPreview.name: MindsDB
listingsPreview.tagLine: An open-source Machine Learning platform to help developers build AI solutions
listingsPreview.description: MindsDB automates and integrates top machine learning frameworks (including GPT-4) into the data stack as "AI Tables" to streamline the integration of AI into applications, making it accessible to developers of all skill levels. "AI tables" allow you to get predictions via SQL queries and continuously learn from your data.

listingsPreview.name: Morgan Stanley
listingsPreview.tagLine: Training GPT-4 To Help Financial Advisors
listingsPreview.description:
Morgan Stanley isn’t using GPT-4 on a production basis yet, but its experimentation with the technology is pretty far along. It has identified content in over 100,000 of its own documents on which its over 16,000 financial advisors (FAs) might have questions: investment recommendations (what is our research organization’s view on Alphabet stock and what’s the bull and bear case for its future performance?), general business questions (who are the five major competitors to IBM?) and process questions (how do I include an IRA in an irrevocable trust?). It has “fine-tune trained” GPT-4 on these issues with the 100,000 documents as a training corpus. 

Source: https://www.forbes.com/sites/tomdavenport/2023/03/20/how-morgan-stanley-is-training-gpt-to-help-financial-advisors/?sh=2b3d0aaa3fc3

listingsPreview.name: Nuance
listingsPreview.tagLine: Using GPT-4 for medical note-taking
listingsPreview.description:
The OpenAI-powered app will instantly transcribe patient notes during doctor visits. Microsoft-owned Nuance Communications announced it is integrating GPT-4 into its Dragon Ambient Intelligence platform, which is used by hospitals around the country to ease doctor workloads by using AI to listen to patient-provider conversations and write medical visit notes.

Even though AI will help physicians and clinicians carry out the administrative legwork, professionals are still involved every step of the way. Physicians can make edits to the notes that DAX Express generates, and they sign off on them before they are entered into a patient’s electronic health record.

Source: https://www.statnews.com/2023/03/20/microsoft-nuance-gpt4-dax-chatgpt/

listingsPreview.name: Poe by Quora
listingsPreview.tagLine: Poe lets you ask questions to GPT-4

listingsPreview.name: Reflect
listingsPreview.tagLine: An AI note-taking assistant powered by GPT-4
listingsPreview.description:
Reflect keeps track of your thoughts, books, and meetings. Mirror the way your mind works by associating notes through backlinks. Reflect builds you a second brain that you can reference anytime.

Reflect AI now uses the new GPT-4 update released by OpenAI. It’s the same technology that ChatGPT+ runs on, Reflect is the first personal note-taking app to add it.

listingsPreview.name: Repl.it
listingsPreview.tagLine: Experience the power of GPT-4 in this Repl
listingsPreview.description:
Repl.it is a simple yet powerful online IDE, Editor, Compiler, Interpreter, and REPL. 

If you have access to the GPT-4 API, Replit is one of the fastest places to start building with it. They have new templates for Node.js and Python that support GPT-4 right out of the box. Just create a Repl. Place your API key. Click run.

listingsPreview.name: Retool
listingsPreview.tagLine: Build with GPT-4 in Retool
listingsPreview.description:
Retool is the fast way to build internal tools. Drag-and-drop our building blocks and connect them to your databases and APIs to build your own tools, instantly. Connects with Postgres, REST APIs, GraphQL APIs, Firebase, Google Sheets, and more. Used by startups and Fortune 500s. Sign up for free.

The [Smart Block](https://retool.com/blog/gpt4-in-retool/) is available in all Retool cloud instances today. If you’re curious about the step-change improvements GPT-4 offers over GPT-3.5, Retool is one of the first places you can try it out.

listingsPreview.name: Salesforce
listingsPreview.tagLine: Using GPT-4 to power its new Einstein Assistant
listingsPreview.description:
Salesforce will use GPT-4 to power its new Einstein Assistant, which is a digital assistant that will help users with their work. The assistant will be available in the paid version of Salesforce’s chat application. GPT-4 is an advanced language model that can understand natural language and generate human-like responses. With the integration of GPT-4, the Einstein Assistant is expected to provide more accurate and personalized recommendations to users.

Source: https://mpost.io/top-companies-that-adopted-gpt-4/

listingsPreview.name: Semantic Kernel
listingsPreview.tagLine: Integrate cutting-edge LLM technology quickly and easily into your apps
listingsPreview.description:
Semantic Kernel (SK) is a lightweight SDK enabling integration of AI Large Language Models (LLMs) with conventional programming languages. The SK extensible programming model combines natural language semantic functions, traditional code native functions, and embeddings-based memory unlocking new potential and adding value to applications with AI.

SK supports prompt templating, function chaining, vectorized memory, and intelligent planning capabilities out of the box.

listingsPreview.name: SnoopStein
listingsPreview.tagLine: Build a celebrity Twitter chatbot with GPT-4
listingsPreview.description:
A bot powered by GPT-4 & [MindsDB](https://gpt4demo.com/apps/mindsdb).
Post any Tweet mentioning @snoop_stein, and you’ll get a response from our GPT-4 powered rapping physicist. Learn how to build one yourself and give it your own personality.

Check out the detailed [step-by-step guide](https://dev.to/mindsdb/build-a-celebrity-twitter-chatbot-with-gpt-4-3l34) for building a GPT-4 powered bot for your own Twitter account.

listingsPreview.name: Speak
listingsPreview.description: Speak is the first & only app that lets you get real conversational practice without needing a live tutor on the other end. And we build some serious AI tech to make that possible.

listingsPreview.name: Stripe
listingsPreview.tagLine: Using GPT-4 to fight fraud
listingsPreview.description:
Stripe is one of OpenAI’s first collaborators on GPT-4. They pulled together a team of 100 workers from across the organization to drop what they were doing and instead think of how GPT-4 could help create new features or optimize old ones. 

Stripe began incorporating OpenAI products even before GPT-4 — last year, its predecessor, GPT-3, was integrated into their customer service program Stripe Support, to help agents fix problems faster. 

Stripe employees brainstormed a list of 50 possible applications for GPT-4, landing on 15 that were strong enough to already be put into practice. They fell into three main buckets: better understanding the businesses of their customers; providing support for questions about documentation; and monitoring for fraud.

### About Stripe

Stripe is a suite of payment APIs that powers commerce for businesses of all sizes.

Source: https://www.freethink.com/robots-ai/stripe-gpt4

listingsPreview.name: Stripe Docs
listingsPreview.tagLine: GPT-4 powered Stripe Docs
listingsPreview.description:
This enhancement to Stripe’s high-quality documentation will allow developers to pose natural language queries within Stripe Docs to GPT-4, which will answer by summarizing the relevant parts of the documentation or extracting specific pieces of information. This lets developers spend less time reading and more time building.

GPT-4 to Stripe Documentation so you can ask Docs questions like:
- What is test mode?
- What is a PaymentIntent?
- How do I test my Stripe integration?

Then receive responses with a summary and links to relevant docs.

listingsPreview.name: TeamSmart AI
listingsPreview.tagLine: A chrome extension that gives you a team of AI assistants, only one click away.
listingsPreview.description:
**The Chrome extension for a better ChatGPT experience.**

Select an AI team to assist you with your daily work. Ask questions about the article you're reading, get help with programming, or find images to inspire your project.

Each AI team member has their own area of expertise.  And they're always available in your browser, just one click away.

Using TeamSmart does not require purchasing ChatGPT Plus, but an OpenAI API key is needed. Using your own API key is usually much cheaper than ChatGPT Plus!

TeamSmart also provides a better ChatGPT experience. You can ask about your current tab's content, customize your code theme, use markdown, check domain availability, and more.

All data is securely stored locally, and nothing is shared with third parties.

Discover AI-assisted efficiency with TeamSmart today!

listingsPreview.name: Tome
listingsPreview.tagLine: Creating an entire presentation from a Wikipedia article using GPT-4
listingsPreview.description:
Bring ideas to life in seconds using video, interactivity, and live data. With the help of GPT-4, [Tome](https://gpt3demo.com/apps/tome-app) can ingest an entire Wikipedia article, understand it, and output a summarized tome with just the key points. 

Source: https://twitter.com/keithpeiris/status/1635744012081729536

listingsPreview.name: Superflow
listingsPreview.tagLine: Bring the power of GPT-4 to your website
listingsPreview.description: Easily annotate and collaborate on live websites with Superflow. Cut review cycles by 40% and create products that your customers will love with Superflow's collaboration features

listingsPreview.name: Visual Studio Code
listingsPreview.description: Visual Studio Code is a code editor redefined and optimized for building and debugging modern web and cloud applications.  Visual Studio Code is free and available on your favorite platform - Linux, macOS, and Windows.

listingsPreview.name: Watermelon
listingsPreview.tagLine: Bring all your customer service channels, your team and your own GPT-4 chatbot in one place.
listingsPreview.description: Transform your customer service department with a super efficient, consistent and personal customer service chatbot build on top of the GPT-4 technology.
